definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: Study on Safety and Immunogenicity of Lyophilized Live Atlenuated Domestic Varicella Vaccine.
sentences.chinese: 国产冻干水痘减毒活疫苗的安全性和免疫原性研究。

sentences.english: A day later he developed a rash that was diagnosed as chicken pox and he was sent home.
sentences.chinese: 一天之后他出疹子，被诊断为水痘，他被送回家。

sentences.english: The measles and chicken pox vaccines also are made from a live attenuated virus.
sentences.chinese: 麻疹和水痘疫苗也是由经稀释的活病毒制成。

sentences.english: Effective prevention of infection after injection, the effect of varicella over 98%.
sentences.chinese: 注射后有效预防感染水痘的效果达98%。

sentences.english: When chicken pox fever, antipyretics can eat it?
sentences.chinese: 出水痘时发高烧，可以吃退烧药吗？

sentences.english: After a person recovers from chickenpox, the virus stays in the body.
sentences.chinese: 个体在从水痘疾病中恢复后，病毒仍人存在机体内。

sentences.english: Chickenpox is a very common disease among children.
sentences.chinese: 水痘是儿童十分常见的一种疾病。

sentences.english: Chicken pox is a common childhood sickness.
sentences.chinese: 水痘是儿童时期的常见病。

sentences.english: There is no previous history of chickenpox.
sentences.chinese: 该童之前并无水痘发生之病史。

sentences.english: In most cases, getting chickenpox once means you will not get it again.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数情况下，一旦得到水痘意味着你不会得到它。

sentences.english: Chicken pox occurs mostly in winter and spring, but can happen any time of the year.
sentences.chinese: 水痘主要发生在冬季和春季，但随时可能发生的一年。

sentences.english: You can also get it if you touch the fluid from a chickenpox blister.
sentences.chinese: 您还可以，如果你接触的流体从水痘疱疹。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the clinical effects of live attenuated varicella vaccine.
sentences.chinese: 目的观察水痘减毒活疫苗的临床效果。

sentences.english: Thomas came down with chicken-pox at the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 在周末的时候患上了水痘。

sentences.english: The coverage rate of the varicella vaccine for children is in the rising trend.
sentences.chinese: 本市儿童水痘疫苗接种率呈上升趋势。

definition: hand foot and mouth disease, HFMD, caused by a number of intestinal viruses, usually affecting young children
epidemic encephalitis B (abbr. for 乙型腦炎|乙型脑炎[yi3 xing2 nao3 yan2])
